column4: Hello...I am trying to load ubuntu from an external HD using EasyBCD....I don't know what the bootloader path is, though, or if I have grub installed properly. How can I tell?
when nmo one answers you just repeat periodicaly ,  this is a busy channel we miss some
are you booting from the interenal drive or from the external ?
are you booting from the interenal drive or from the external ?
I would assume the internal, although ubuntu is on the external hard drive
if you can , try booting from the external , supossing ubuntu was completely installed on the external grub incluede
I don't know if grub was installed. I used the alternate CD install, live didn't work
EasyBCD's bootloader path mentions a \NST\nst_grub.mbr , which I don't see on the HD.
just to recap here can you actualy boot ubuntu or not ? what exactly is the issue ?
Ubuntu shows on the vista bootloader, but I can't boot into ubuntu
that's when you boot from the internal hdd I assume,  try booting from the exxternal, see what happens,  I can't realy help you much,  I don'T know about bdc and about vista bootloader
i can't find a folder \nst\ or a nst_grub.mbr file
I dont think those aer folder you can access ,but I might bewrong
I'll stop now I'm realy not able to hlep you
where is the .mbr usually on Ubuntu?
